name: Wyndham Grand

reviews.text: This hotel is massive and is set out in a series of buildings each with its own courtyard. It has a very attractive pool area and restaurants which cater for both European and Asian tastes. The buffet breakfast is very good. We had dinner at the Indian restaurant, which was a little strong for my kids palettes, and I have to warn you that the "welcome drink" at the Indian restaurant is an acquired taste! The room was 5 star with all amenities, although the hot water was a little cooler than I would have liked.
reviews.title: Big and beautiful

reviews.text: We ate several small meals at the cafe in the main building - but found both this and the Indian Restaurant relatively pricey.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel where the staff is still working it out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautifully grand hotel with large and spacious rooms. Our initial room smelled a little funky and the staff promptly moved us to a new room without issues.
reviews.title: Well located near the Taj Mahal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is central to get everywhere you need.
reviews.title: Disappointing stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were all super friendly and patient; however, it seems that they are still muddling to figure out their systems and processes. While checking in, the key programming wasn't working properly, so they let us into rooms with their master while they figured it out. Once keys were ready, they only worked 1/4 times with a requisite trip back to the front desk for help (good thing it isn't too far).
reviews.title: Bit run down but otherwise good.

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed for one night, unfortunately all of the room lights kept switching on by themselves every half to one hour so the nights sleep was not a good one despite turning off the master switch and individual switches each time.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but could be better

reviews.text: The main dining room were empyu probually due to the high prices in the menu but the buffet dinner was busy with both foriegners and local patrons as the only alternatitive option.
reviews.title: Not happy

reviews.text: Breakfast was very good
reviews.title: Grand Hotel

reviews.text: I just recently got back from Wyndham hotel in India and I was so unhappy that I decided to type a review. Yes I admit the landscape was beautiful but the hotel itself was not good. The lights kept going out in the room and after saying something to them they kept insisting that it would be fixed in 2 minutes in which it still kept doing it the rest of the night. The fridge did not work in the room and the crew kept stating that it was working and just the light in the fridge was not working. Ended up waking up at 5:00am dripping with sweat because the electricity and air condition in the room had to of been turned off for some time.
reviews.title: Fabulous Property - operations details a little missing

reviews.text: We enjoyed a short one night stay in two twin bed rooms. The hotel is certainly grand and was practically empty during our stay - we rarely saw another soul and we were the only diners in the restaurant. The service in the restaurant, Pakhtoon, was extremely attentive with particular mention to Varun and the other waiters working on the evening of 2nd Oct. Breakfast buffet was also delicious with made to order eggs and Indian breakfast on hand. As mentioned by other reviewers, we experienced some short power outages which resulted in our lights turning on a number of times in the middle of the night. WiFi was charged by the hour so we didn't use it.
reviews.title: Sleeping in a Palace
superb!!
reviews.text: i too was a little hesitant when the travel operator suggested this hotel,but it proved wrong.Once we stepped in we were greeted with garlands apart from the welcome drink.The rooms were wonderful and the staff were very cordial,right from the reception to the restaurant bar and everywhere.I strongly recommend this hotel all who love tranquil ambience and definitely will stay here again!

reviews.title: Beautiful new hotel--a must stay
reviews.text: We loved this hotel. It was a late decision by our tour guide in India, and we are so glad they found it. It was elegant and beautiful and clean. The staff and the accommodations were all top quality. I don't know how much we spent for the one night, since it was included in our package, but I would recommend it to anybody. It is close to other 5-star hotels, so there is no need to look at a different location. It is close to the Taj Mahal for an early morning visit (and not much in India is accessible without a considerable amount of traveling.) We loved the restaurant and the service there, too. What a great hotel and a huge complex! One of the best swimming pools of all the hotels on our trip.

reviews.title: Beautiful new hotel!
reviews.text: I have to admit I was slightly hesitant about staying at this hotel since there were no reviews yet on TA and limited photos on the website - our travel agent recommended it when the hotel of our choice was booked. I then realized that the reason why there aren't reviews is because it's only been open for about three months (as of March '11).

reviews.title: New, Luxurious, Clean and Friendly Hotel (with some minor growing pains)
reviews.text: Our family stayed at the Orient Taj in July on a short trip to Agra in July. This is a relatively new property in a very competetive luxury hotel market in Agra. The property owner (not a hotelier by profession) has taken great care in building an luxurious and well-appointed property. The attention to detail and quality of construction shows throughout the property. The staff is also very friendly and attentive.

reviews.title: Good location, ambience, and service
reviews.text: We called about 20 min. ahead of our arrival to validate directions. When we arrived they were ready with marigold garlands and cool fruit juice! Welcome respite from the July heat of Agra! The check-in process was relatively painless. When we asked for one of the rooms to be moved, they did it without any fuss (perhaps because there were plenty of rooms avialable - only 6 out of the approximately 200 rooms were occupied during the night that we were there).

reviews.title: Best Hotel Ever!
reviews.text: The rooms themselves are very well appointed with really (really!) comfortable beds. The bathrooms were clean and well maintained. The gardens and the landscaping is relatively mature and is kept in good condition. There was an awesome pool which we didn't have time to use :(

reviews.title: A Step into Paradise
reviews.text: But it was not all roses and rainbows. There was no hot water in the bathrooms! I called the front desk and they said that there was some maintenance going on and will have hot water available in about 20 min. But even after an hour (and another 2 calls later), there was still no hot water. By then we gave up as we had to be at the Taj and had to make do with a cold shower.

reviews.title: Friendly Staff, made to feel special
reviews.text: When we were checking out, I complained to the front desk that it was unacceptable that a five-star property which was charging us an arm-and-a-leg was unable to provide hot water. They were very apologetic about the issue and offered almost 1/3rd of the price off. I felt that it was a very generous gesture on their part to ensure customer satisfaction.

This hotel is located in a huge property about 5-10 min drive to Taj Mahal and Fort Agra. I have booked a room a few months before my trip through Expedia and the deal was really good, at 65$ a night. This is well worth it. I and my friend enjoyed this so much.
reviews.title: Wonderful time at Wyndham Grand

reviews.text: Upon Arrival, we were greeted like a very important guest. The staffs are very nice and polite. We had a slight problem with our reservation as we reserved for a double bed room, but all those are booked. So the staff was upgraded our room to a suite. That is so great. The room is so spacious and looks so nice! The bathroom is so big with a jetstream bathtub.
reviews.title: Pricey but worth it

reviews.text: I am mentioning a staff member named Nakshatra. She explained and showed us several things about the property very well while we were walking to the room at the back of the hotel. We were greeted again with her wonderful smile on our departure.
reviews.title: Impressive concept ruined by a lack of attention to detail, poor service, and exorbitant prices

reviews.text: Overall experience is so great and we will definitely come back to this hotel if we have a chance to visit Agra.
reviews.title: Really very well crafted property, and royal stay.

reviews.text: We stayed here as a bit of a treat after a hard slog of roughing it throughout India. The hotel itself is opulent and very grand. It is almost like staying in a gated community, the noise and hustle and bustle is firmly kept on the other side of the gates. It is designed along the lines of the Agra fort with red sandstone and the rooms outside the main building each in the own section.
reviews.title: Mughal era recaptured

reviews.text: 2) After the first staff member came to refill our mini bar, we received another visit from the housekeeping staff. He came to change our towels...we had just checked in, why would we need a change in towels? And, this guy had the nerve to tell us that he would not be working tomorrow and that he cleaned our room this morning (hinting for a tip). Ridiculous!
reviews.title: Grand? Not Quite!

reviews.text: 3) Internet cost is 800 rupees for 24 hours - what a rip off. Even at that price I tried to purchase it but it took 3 phones calls and about 30 minutes to get it to work. They had to bring in a router into our room. At least they comped the cost of internet.
reviews.title: Well located for Taj Mahal

reviews.text: 4) There was an electrical problem in the room so when we turned off all the lights to go to bed, there was loud clicking and then every 30 seconds, flashes of light would appear. We had to turn off the master power switch to sleep in peace but it was hot because the A/C was off. We didn't complain that evening because it was already past 11pm. To move to a new room would have been more annoying. This kind of thing should really be checked out from time to time. I at least did the service of alerting the front desk upon check out.
reviews.title: Fully enjoyed at Wyndham Grand

reviews.text: Impressive entrance, amazing gardens and an even more amazing swimming pool. Rooms were a little disappointing, smelt musty, adaptors did not fit correctly, many power cuts. The beds were not the best, and squeaked if you moved!
reviews.title: Golden Triangle, second stop!
The Best IN Agra
reviews.text: Poor choice of breakfast for british guests , roof top restaurant -where was it? Cocktail bar and tea room was excellent, lovely staff and very friendly service. Still thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a big style international hotel, which is actually the opposite of what we normally go for.
reviews.title: Opposite of What We Normally Go For...

reviews.text: It turned out to be a perfect choice. The hotel is big, clean, luxurious and has plenty to offer. When we stayed we practically had the massive swimming pool to ourselves. It was nice as Agra itself, aside from the obvious, doesn't have too much to offer. We spent most of the morning and early afternoon doing the sights, but when they ran dry came back to the hotel to enjoy the swimming pool, complimentary spa area etc which was just perfect in the hot weather. If we were in a smaller hotel, we could have perhaps got a little cabin fever as we didn't feel that there was to much else to do in Agra.
reviews.title: New but already worned
Taj Mahal style luxury hotel
reviews.text: Food was very good.

Wonderful hotel. The grounds are magnificent and the rooms are huge and beautiful. The hotel is only a few klms from the Taj which makes it the ideal place to stay. The staff are very attentive and polite. Just loved our stay there. Spent an afternoon by the huge pool.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.text: The hotel looks better in the pictures that what it actually is. The rooms are good but give you an over all impression of being a bit tacky. Was told that the Hotel is just 2 years old but surely everything looks much older. Not definitely a 5 star . The food was below par not only for the price but also for variety. I had overseas Italian guests with me and the only food that was available was a very strange buffet menu served in the open OR a fine dining Indian which we did not want to have. My most embarrassing moment was the wine List. Only Indian. I regretted offering a bottle over the meal. The location is perfect being only a 10 minute drive to the Taj.
reviews.title: Fine place

reviews.text: Very impressive great location a few minutes from the Taj Mahal.
reviews.title: Grand it is reminds me of Dubai or Lad Vagas.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I couldn't help feeling I was in a 5 star hotel in Dubai the lobby is grand and beautiful very nice gardens in the centre of a huge complex of rooms a real luxury feel about the place.
reviews.title: Rip Off Merchants

reviews.text: Excellent staff and spacious rooms. Would like to go back and spend more time there!
reviews.title: One of the best if your budget doesn't allow for Amar Vilas

description: Wyndham Grand located in the city of Taj, has been built on 18 acres of land with a large frontage. A beautiful hotel property inspired by the intricacy of Mughal architecture with splendid lawns, fountains and ancient interiors that take you back to an era of emperors and princes with the modern facilities. A masterpiece of architecture it is built on ''Mughal Theme'' with world class modern hi-tech amenities. It is attracting global leisure & business Tourists. The royal ambience, the intricate craftsmanship and the beautiful landscape makes it the most preferred destination in the itinerary of tourists. A visual delight for holiday makers as it revives the grandeur of the Mughal Emperors.Wyndham Grand Agra is perfect for an extended break with its idyllic settings, perfect location and world–class amenities. The hotel has 160 spacious suites and rooms. It offers many leisure options, including a large swimming pool and a luxury spa. The hotel has a variety of dining options, The Orient Café, Jharokha, Pakhtoon, Zaiqa serve authentic Mughalai , Indian and international cuisines. While Mharo Gaon, the village theme speciality restaurant is one of the major attractions in the city. Experience the heavenly beauty of Agra in all its tranquil glory. Recreated and preserved to awaken and rejuvenate your senses … to make you experience pure bliss. We offer many facilities, such as:-• Agra’s largest swimming pool with a submerged Pool Bar • Al-Sehat (Spa), Gymnasium, Steam & Sauna• Ta-Dhin (Discotheque)• Kiddies Playground with slides• Lobby & Lounge • Conference & Banquet Halls • Banquet Lawns • Reception, Luggage Store & Travel desk• Wireless internet connectivity• Tennis Court/ Basketball court • Mughal Garden. Our rooms are well integrated with the following features:- Entertainment: • LCD TV with remote • DVD Player • Cable channels Bed Features: • Bed side electronic control panels • Telephone/ cordless • International direct dialling telephones lines Dining: • 24 hours room service • Minibar • Tea/Coffee maker Rooms Features: • Non-Smoking rooms • In-room amenities • Air conditioning • Direct dial telephone • Electrical outlet at desk level • Bathrobes • Bathroom amenities • Hair dryer • Safe • Bathroom telephone • High-speed internet access / WiFi • Bathtub/shower • Iron and ironing board • Minibar • Newspaper on request
